qas.question: Can pesticides have a serious effect on people?

answers.text: cause acute and delayed health effects

qas.question: What is one of the most serious effects of exposure to pesticides?
What is thought to possibly cause neurobehavioral alterations?
What system is mostly affected by non-Hodgkin lymphoma?
What two things can happen if you are pregnant and being treated for cancer?
What problems do hormones produced by cancer cells cause?
When was Non-Hodgkin lymphoma first diagnosed in a patient?

plausible_answers.text: irritation of the skin and eyes

qas.question: What is one thing that can be caused by the use of cosmetics?

context: Pesticides may <a0_0>cause acute and delayed health effects<a0_0/> in people who are exposed. Pesticide exposure can cause a variety of adverse health effects, ranging from simple <b7_0>irritation of the skin and eyes<b7_0/> to more severe effects such as affecting <b3_0>the nervous system<b3_0/>, mimicking hormones causing <b5_0>reproductive problems<b5_0/>, and also causing <a1_0>cancer<a1_0/>. A <b6_0>2007<b6_0/> systematic review found that "most studies on non-Hodgkin lymphoma and leukemia showed positive associations with pesticide exposure" and thus concluded that cosmetic use of pesticides should be decreased. There is substantial evidence of associations between <a2_0>organophosphate insecticide exposures<a2_0/> and neurobehavioral alterations.  Limited evidence also exists for other negative outcomes from pesticide exposure including neurological, <b4_0>birth defects, fetal death<b4_0/>,
